input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: DellAIMActor.

Creates and adds a new network connection to an existing vmrack.
Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <targets> <target> <host>localhost</host> <user-name>admin</user-name> <password encryption-type="Base64">YWRtaW4=</password> <protocol>https</protocol> <port>443</port> <use-ssl-certificate>true</use-ssl-certificate> <allow-unsigned-certificate>true</allow-unsigned-certificate> <install-certificate>true</install-certificate> <passphrase>changeit</passphrase> </target> </targets> <target>config1</target> <vmrack-id>PI_WEBSTORE_APACHE.5.0</vmrack-id> <network-connection> <ip-assignment-type>dhcp</ip-assignment-type> <register-with-dns>default</register-with-dns> <netbios-over-tcp>default</netbios-over-tcp> <id>NET101</id> <name>TEST_NETWROK101</name> <description></description> <primary-channel>1</primary-channel> <secondary-channel>2</secondary-channel> <wins-address>test</wins-address> <dhcp-hostname>Webstore Apache1</dhcp-hostname> <enabled>false</enabled> <network-id>VS_WEBSTORE_APACHE.1.0</network-id> <ip-addresses> <ip-address> <address>192.168.30.41</address> <subnet-mask>255.255.255.0</subnet-mask> <virtual>true</virtual> </ip-address> </ip-addresses> </network-connection> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
targets[Conditional]: This tag is required when dynamic target configuration needs to be provided in the request. If no target configuration was provided while enabling and configuring an adapter then it is required to provide this tag. Multiple target configurations can be provided inside this tag.
target[Conditional]: There are two ways in which this tag can be specified.
First Option: This tag when provided under "targets" tag will contain a dynamic target configuration information.
Second Option: When this tag is provided directly under "item" tag then it specifies the target configuration of Dell AIM Controller on which the request will be executed.
Valid values: The value specified for <target> XML element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Default value: If this element is not provided or left empty, the request will be executed on the first defined Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Note: If "target" tag is provided at both the places then dynamic targets configuration will take precedence.
host[Conditional]: Host name or IP address of Dell AIM Controller. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
user-name[Conditional]: Username required to authenticate Dell AIM Controller. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets.
password[Conditional]: The password associated with the <user-name> provided. Encrypted password can be provided by providing an "encryption-type" attribute. This tag is required while providing dynamic targets. Valid values for encryption-type are: Plain, Base64
protocol[Optional]: Protocol to connect Dell AIM Controller. This tag is valid here only while providing dynamic targets. Valid values - http, https. Default value - http
port[Optional]: Port associated with protocol provided. This tag is valid here only while providing dynamic targets. Default values - 80 for "http" protocol and 443 for "https" protocol.
use-ssl-certificate[Optional]: Determines whether to establish a secure connection. This tag is valid here only while providing dynamic targets. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false
allow-unsigned-certificate[Optional]: Specifies whether to allow unsigned certificates from trusted zones. This tag is valid here only while providing dynamic targets. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false
install-certificate[Optional]: Determines whether to install certificates. This tag is valid here only while providing dynamic targets. Valid values: true, false. Default value: false
passphrase[Optional]: Specifies the Java Standard Trust Keystore passphrase. This tag is valid here only while providing dynamic targets. Default value: changeit
vmrack-id[Required] ID of the vmrack to which the network connection will be added.
network-connection[Required] Parent tag that contains all the network connection information.
ip-assignment-type[Optional] The network connection IP address assignment type. Valid values are: dhcp - if the network’s IP address is assigned via DHCP Static - if the network connection’s IP address is statically assigned VoeAssigned - if the network connection’s IP address is assigned by the Dell AIM Controller Default value - Static
register-with-dns[Optional] The way the network connection is registered with the DNS server. Valid values are: disabled - explicitly disables registration with the DNS server Default - DNS registration is disabled addDNSSuffix - enables registeration with DNS suffix appended to the hostname Default value - disabled
netbios-over-tcp[Optional] The network connection’s NetBIOS over TCP status. Valid values are: disabled - disables NetBIOS over TCP protocol for the network connection Default - equivalent to enabled. enabled - enables NetBIOS over TCP protocol for the network connection. Default value - disabled
id[Optional] ID of the network connection. Valid values - Any String
name[Optional] The name of the network connection. Valid values - Any String between 1 and 15 characters in length. Network Connection names can only contain alphanumeric characters plus dash (-) underscore (_) and period (.)
description[Optional] The network connection’s description. Valid values - Any String
primary-channel[Optional] Primary Dell AIM network channel of the vmrack this network connection is assigned to.
secondary-channel[Optional] Secondary Dell AIM network channel of the vmrack this network connection is assigned to.
wins-address[Optional] For Windows vmracks, the address of the Windows Internet Name Service (WINS). Valid values - Valid WNS address string
dhcp-hostname[Optional] The hostname of the vmrack the network connection is assigned to.
enabled[Optional] This is a boolean field. This is true if the network connection is enabled; false otherwise. Valid values - true, false Default values - true
network-id[Required] The ID of the network the vmrack is connected to using this network connection. Valid values - Valid network id
Note: ip-addresses node and its children nodes are required if an array of IP addresses need to be assigned to network connection. ip-addresses[Conditional] This is the parent tag that contains a list of IP addresses.
ip-address[Conditional] Tag that contains the individual details of an IP address.
address[Conditional] The IP address to be assigned to vmrack. Valid values - Any valid IP address
subnet-mask[Conditional] The subnet mask for the IP address. Valid values - Valid subnet mask
virtual[Optional] This is a boolean field. true, if the IP address is virtual; false, otherwise. Valid values - true, false

documentation.description: Creates and adds a new network connection to an existing vmrack.
